summary: Docs and release-note/versioning markdown files were added for store submission, and web branding references were updated to point at a generated app icon path. However, the diff summary does not show actual Android/iOS release build configuration changes (package IDs/versionCode/build number) nor creation of the required asset pack files under frontend/public/assets/generated. Several unrelated gameplay and UI features were modified/added that are outside the BuildRequest scope.

missing_requirements.requirement: Prepare an Android release submission build for Google Play, including generating a Play-ready Android App Bundle (AAB), ensuring the appâ€™s package identifiers and versioning are set for release, and providing the final build artifact path(s) and release notes (English).
missing_requirements.reason: While an Android submission guide file was added, the diff summary does not provide evidence of (a) a reproducible command that produces an AAB, (b) actual Android release versioning changes in build configuration (e.g., versionName/versionCode), or (c) explicit artifact output paths/instructions for locating the AAB.
evidence: frontend/docs/store-submission/android-google-play.md (added, content truncated before build commands/output paths)

missing_requirements.requirement: Prepare an iOS release submission build for the Apple App Store, including producing a release archive suitable for App Store Connect submission and providing step-by-step signing/provisioning instructions required for a developer to export an IPA (English).
missing_requirements.reason: An iOS submission guide file was added, but the diff summary does not show a complete reproducible build/archive command sequence nor evidence of actual iOS version/build number updates in project config. The guide content is truncated before the key build/export steps, so IPA export instructions cannot be confirmed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add an App Store / Play Store submission asset pack under frontend/public/assets/generated containing the required icons and store listing visuals with the exact filenames listed, plus an English README mapping files to console upload slots.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows references to /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_1024x1024.png in HTML and sitemap, but does not show the required asset files being added under frontend/public/assets/generated, nor an asset-pack README describing mapping to Google Play/App Store slots.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/modified extensive game-related UI and 3D gameplay features (Golumanji, character selection, missions, Chapter 7, HUD dialogue, Pac-Man-like mini-game) unrelated to preparing store submission builds/assets.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is focused on producing submission-ready Android/iOS builds, versioning, release notes, and store assets. Game features are not requested and expand scope significantly.

hallucinated_features.description: Added backend health check query and additional React Query integration changes beyond store submission preparation.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-7/8/9 do not request new diagnostic queries or backend-integration changes; they focus on store build packaging and assets.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt: frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts (mentions new backend health check query)

hallucinated_features.description: Navigation/UI feature work (QueryClientProvider wrapper, new Governance navigation entry, portfolio section styling) beyond store submission preparation.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested in REQ-7/8/9; may be product work but is outside the stated scope.

hallucinated_features.description: Release notes text claims new/expanded product capabilities (staking, governance proposals, exchange integrations, multilingual support) that were not requested as part of store-build preparation and may contradict the non-goal about not implementing new token purchase/claim/staking features.
hallucinated_features.reason: Even if only documentation, these claims are outside the submission-build request and could be misleading relative to the stated non-goals.
